Tool Performance.original_text: My favorite feature, and the reason I bought the CAD II BBP is its long reach.
The top and bottom cubes that rotate so you can punch the correct size of eyelet have a bit of wiggle room, so that the top and bottom points don't come precisely together.
Tool Performance.improvement_wish: Precise alignment of rotating cubes without wiggle room

Tool Performance.original_text: The tool can still set eyelets, but one side of the eyelet gets a bit more squashed down than the other side.
Tool Performance.improvement_wish: Uniform compression on all sides of the eyelet

Cutting Performance.original_text: When I attempted to cut regular cardstock (80 lb) with this die, I had to finish the cut with my trusty #11 X-Acto blade.
Cutting Performance.improvement_wish: Clean cutting through 80lb cardstock without requiring manual finishing with craft knife

Cutting Performance.original_text: I attempted to cut this die with both my Big Shot die cutting machine and my Sizzix Grand Calibur machine, but neither yielded a completely clean cut, even when I used a shim.
Cutting Performance.improvement_wish: Consistent clean cutting performance across all compatible die-cutting machines

Cutting Performance.original_text: It took an extra fifteen minutes to free up the oval ivy border from the excess card stock.
Cutting Performance.improvement_wish: Design that allows cut pieces to separate easily from excess material without additional work

Product Features.original_text: All of the Cottage Cutz dies come with a thin piece of sticky-backed foam that you fit over the die face.
